## Arpeggio: Minor 7th in F#

An arpeggio is a musical technique where the notes of a chord are played in a sequence, rather than all together. The Minor 7th arpeggio in F# consists of the notes F#, A, C#, and E. In this case, it includes the root note F#, the minor third A, the perfect fifth C#, and the minor seventh E.

### Notes and Intervals:
- F# (Root)
- A (Minor 3rd)
- C# (Perfect 5th)
- E (Minor 7th)

### Genre and Musical Flavor:
The Minor 7th arpeggio in F# is commonly used in jazz, funk, and R&B music genres. It adds a soulful and jazzy flavor to the music, creating a smooth and sophisticated sound. The tension created by the minor 7th interval adds depth and color to chord progressions and melodies.

### Songs Featuring Minor 7th Arpeggio in F#:
1. **"Cissy Strut" by The Meters**: This funk instrumental track prominently features the Minor 7th arpeggio in F# in its groovy guitar riffs.
  
2. **"All Blues" by Miles Davis**: A classic jazz composition where the Minor 7th arpeggio in F# can be heard in various improvisational sections, adding a mellow and bluesy vibe to the piece.
  
3. **"Use Me" by Bill Withers**: This R&B/soul song utilizes F# Minor 7th arpeggios in its chord progressions, contributing to the laid-back and soulful atmosphere of the tune.
